xyz.fsgek.common.net.tcp

Interface GekTcpChannelHandler<M>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - message type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DelimiterBasedTcpChannelHandler, LengthBasedTcpChannelHandler

    public interface GekTcpChannelHandler<M>
    TCP/IP network channel callback handler.

    An implementation of GekTcpServer has a list of GekTcpChannelHandler.

    When the server receives new data from remote point, the data will be wrapped as ByteBuffer and passed to onMessage(GekTcpChannel, Object) of first handler. Returned object from first handler will be passed to next handler as message, and so on. If null is returned, the handlers calling chain will be broken; if an exception is thrown, GekTcpServerHandler.onException(GekTcpChannel, Throwable, ByteBuffer) will be called and the handlers calling chain will also be broken.

    onMessage(GekTcpChannel, Object) only be called when new data was received, for more detailed operations, try GekTcpServerHandler.onLoop(GekTcpChannel, boolean, ByteBuffer).

    If buffer of the channel is full, it will not read and put again. If the remaining data from the last callback has not been consumed, it will be left until the next callback.

    See the built-in handler implementations: LengthBasedTcpChannelHandler, DelimiterBasedTcpChannelHandler.

    See Also:
    LengthBasedTcpChannelHandler, DelimiterBasedTcpChannelHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      @Nullable java.lang.Object onMessage(GekTcpChannel channel, M message)
      Callback when new data has received.

    • Method Detail

      • onMessage

        @Nullable
@Nullable java.lang.Object onMessage(GekTcpChannel channel,
                                                M message)
        Callback when new data has received.

        Server has a list of handlers, the first handler will be passed a ByteBuffer as message parameter, then returned object from first handler will be passed to next handler as message parameter, and so on. If null is returned from any handler, the handlers calling chain will be broken at that handler; if an exception is thrown, GekTcpServerHandler.onException(GekTcpChannel, Throwable, ByteBuffer) will be called and the calling chain will also be broken. The process like: 

             Object message = ByteBuffer.wrap(...);
     for (GekNetChannelHandler<...> channelHandler : channelHandlers) {
         try {
             Object result = channelHandler.onMessage(channel, message);
             if (result == null) {
                 break;
             }
             message = result;
         } catch (Throwable e) {
             serverHandler.onException(channel, e, remaining);
             break;
         }
     }
        If buffer of the channel is full, it will not read and put again. If the buffer on this callback is not fully consumed (remaining() > 0), the remaining data will be reserved to next calling. However, the handler chain will be called if and only if there has new data read from the remote endpoint. It's best to try to consume as much as possible for each time, or using GekTcpServerHandler.onLoop(GekTcpChannel, boolean, ByteBuffer) to deal with un-consumed data.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel
        message - the message
        Returns:
        result of callback
